GlobalGoodsType.title: Software
GlobalGoodsType.description: A free and open-source software tool designed to manage, analyze, or transmit health-related data, with proven utility in multiple settings.

Interoperability.name: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources
Interoperability.description: A standard describing data formats and elements and an application programming interface for exchanging electronic health records

ProductOverview.Summary: mHero is a two-way, mobile phoneâ€“based communication system that connects ministries of health and health workers.
ProductOverview.Description: mHero brings together existing health information systems with locally popular communication platforms to facilitate the exchange of important health information. It reduces the barriers that can exist between health workers and their support systems, playing a critical role in ensuring effective and efficient responses, particularly in a crisis.
ProductOverview.Users: The primary users are ministry of health and healthcare workers in facilities, labs, and other sites, as well as training participants.

Reach.SummaryOfReach: mHero has been deployed in seven countries to date and was used during the pandemic response in Kenya and Liberia to send guidance to health workers about COVID-19 including urgent alerts, new testing, and treatment guidelines, and to train health workers on infection prevention and control and risk communication.

Sustainability.Description: mHero is supported by grant funding, implementation funding, SaaS, organizational funding.
